response.answer_text: Before getting into the details of Class 9 preparation, let us look at the main subjects of Class 9:  CBSE Class 9 Preparation: Best Books For CBSE Class 9 The syllabus for each subject of CBSE Class 9 is very basic. For CBSE Class 9 preparation, if you finish the NCERT textbooks of the respective subjects thoroughly, you don’t need anything else. You can refer to online materials like articles and videos in case you do not understand any topic. But all in all, the NCERT books are sufficient. CBSE Class 9 Preparation: Timetable For Class 9 CBSE A daily study of 6 hours is enough for CBSE Class 9 preparation. However, those 6 hours must be properly spent without wasting any moment. Keep the following points in mind while you prepare timetable for Class 9:  CBSE Class 9 Preparation: How To Study Class 9 CBSE Subjects? Let us now look into how ti study the various subjects of CBSE Class 9: How To Score Good Marks In Science Class 9 CBSE: Understand each and every concept of Physics, Chemistry and Biology from the NCERT textbooks. In case you find it difficult to understand any topic, use online resources. Make notes as you study. Learn important definitions, experiments, short descriptions, reactions, equations, formulas, etc. Solve the questions at the end of the chapters. How To Score Good Marks In Maths Class 9 CBSE: The CBSE Class 9 Maths syllabus comprises of mainly basic arithmetic, algebra, geometry and mensuration, probability,etc. Finishing the NCERT textbook thoroughly is enough. Understand the various concepts and theorems, learn the formulas, and practice the example problems as well as the problems at the end of the chapters thoroughly. How To Score Good Marks In Social Science Class 9 CBSE: Subjects like History, Geography, and Civics needs one to have the habit of reading thoroughly and remember a lot of terms and names. It also requires one to have story-telling abilities. Read the NCERT textbooks thoroughly and make notes of important things (like year, name of rivers, etc.) as you study. Revise them regularly. Maintain notes as these subjects often need a bit of writing. How To Score Good Marks In Literature Class 9 CBSE: English and Hindi/Sanskrit are easy subjects. Refer to the textbooks. For grammar, use some standard reference books as having a firm knowledge of grammar will be very helpful in future. CBSE Class 9 Preparation: How To Become Topper In Class 9 Scoring very high in Class 9 is very easy if you study properly from the very beginning. It will also help you to crack exams like NTSE and Olympiads which are very prestigious and provides various scholarships and prizes. Keep the following points in mind as you study for CBSE Class 9 and you will definitely become a topper:  Best of luck!!!

You can be either of the two types: A smart student who gets every concept easily.Or , not so smart one who'll need to work hard.Either way ,you'll need to Work hard and Study smart. Few important tips are: 1.Read NCERT carefully and thoroughly. The questions in exam will be based on NCERT. So, study it thoroughly. The side books may seem tempting but many times, they miss certain topics or facts that NCERT has. NCERT is your main book ,so read it through and through. 2. Build your concept. Take help of reference-books to build your concept. But, don't entirely depend upon them . I repeat, Don't entirely depend upon them. This can really screw your exams. 3.Take notes. I can't emphasis enough how important it is. Taking notes will not only help you understand topics well but will also help you remember them . It will also help you to skip any topic. 4. Follow a time-table. A routine is very necessary to inculcate discipline. And , you won't be able to stay focussed without discipline once you loose motivation. 5. Exercise everyday. A healthy mind resides in a healthy body. You won't be able to study if you're sick. 6. Study everyday. You must not skip study at all , no matter what. It is necessary you keep the momentum going. 7. Give time to every subject. You should not ignore any subject ,no matter how good you are in it. Over confidence can be your undoing. 8. Don't loose confidence. The person sitting next to you , beside you or in front of you IS NOT you. Don't compare yourself with any one . You have your own pace. Look sometimes it gets really hard to continue when you see everyone ahead of you. But, it is also true that most people are ‘ all talk and no action' . They may not be as strong or ahead as they claim. Stick to your plan and finish your syllabus on time. That's what important. 9. And lastly, take a chill pill. Don't go too hard on yourself . Not getting 90% is not the end of yourself. You won't die if you don't. And always stay true to yourself.
